summary.p: Sends the following books (with price information) - he will send the rest as soon as he finds them -: "On the Authority of the Word of God" [by Alexander Alesius], the "Idioms" by [Georg] Witzel, the Hyginus, the Church Order of [Schwäbisch] Hall and [the "Mathesis" by] Firmicus [Maternus]. Announces the three parts of the anatomical work [by Andreas Vesalius], which he can procure entirely if Bullinger wishes; as soon as the index to the main part is completed, he will also procure this for him; Doctor [Vesalius] sends his regards. Further greetings.

div.p: Greetings. I am sending you here, most learned and dearest Bullinger, the books that I could find, and I will send the rest in due time, if I can obtain them in any way:
On the Authority of the Word of God 8 rap.
C. Julius Hyginus, freedman of Augustus 6 batz. Church Order of Schwäbisch Hall 2½ batz. Julius Firmicus etc. 9 batz.

Soon I will also send the anatomical book. There will be three books: 1. It will have everything that pertains to the structure of the human body, described most accurately; 2. It will be an epitome and illustrated with its own large figures; 3. It will be in German, which I have not yet seen, but is already being prepared for the press. If you want all three, I will procure them. Indicate with just one word. After the index to the main volume has been completed, you will have it, if I conveniently come across a courier, and I will assign the price and, as much as I can, buy it at the cheapest, yet fair, price from the doctor, who also sends you his regards.
Farewell in the Lord. Greet Theodor and Phrisius. June 15, 1543.
To Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant pastor of the Church of Zurich, esteemed teacher. Zurich.
